placeholder.exact: Filter by exact name or ID
placeholder.kongManager: Filter by exact name or ID

empty_state.title: Configure a New Route
empty_state.description: Routes proxy requests to an associated Service.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first route
empty_state_v2.group: Routes created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: Routes direct incoming API requests to the appropriate gateway service based on paths, methods, and headers, ensuring efficient traffic flow.

delete.title: Delete a Route
delete.description: Deleting this route will also remove any associated plugins. This action cannot be reversed.

errors.delete: The route could not be deleted at this time.

basic.description: Quickly set up a route with HTTP & HTTPS protocol with the essentials: path, method, and host.
basic.label: Basic

advanced.description: Define complex route logic with other protocols or additional paths or attributes such as headers.
advanced.label: Advanced

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help you identify and manage this route

config.title: Route Configuration
config.description: Route configuration determines how this route will handle incoming requests

name.label: Name
name.tooltip: The name of the Route. Route names must be unique, and they are case sensitive. For example, there can be two different Routes named 'test' and 'Test'.

service.label: Gateway Service
service.tooltip: The Service this Route is associated to. This is where the Route proxies traffic to.

tags.label: Tags
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings associated with the Route for grouping and filtering.
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by commas

protocols.label: Protocols
protocols.tooltip: Choose the protocols this route supports.
protocols.tooltipConfig: An array of the protocols this Route should allow. See the {code1} section for a list of accepted protocols. When set to only {code2}, HTTP requests are answered with an upgrade error. When it is set to only {code3}, this is essentially the same as {code4} in that both HTTP and HTTPS requests are allowed. Default: {code5}.

path_handling.label: Path Handling
path_handling.tooltip: Controls how Kong modifies the request path before proxying to the upstream service. Use v1 for standardized, predictable path behavior. Use v0 for legacy compatibility.

https_redirect_status_code.label: HTTPS Redirect Status Code
https_redirect_status_code.tooltip: Specifies the HTTP status code for redirecting requests from HTTP to HTTPS. Use 301 or 308 for permanent redirects, 302 or 307 for temporary redirects.
https_redirect_status_code.tooltipConfig: The status code Kong responds with when all properties of a Route match except the protocol i.e. if the protocol of the request is {code1} instead of {code2}. {code3}  header is injected by Kong if the field is set to 301, 302, 307 or 308. Note: This config applies only if the Route is configured to only accept the {code4} protocol.

regex_priority.label: Regex Priority
regex_priority.tooltip: Regex priority is determined by length first (longer patterns win), and when lengths are the same, more specific regexes are preferred. When two routes match the path and have the same regex_priority, the older one (lowest created_at) is used. Note that the priority for non-regex routes is different (longer non-regex routes are matched before shorter ones).
regex_priority.tooltipConfig: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using regexes simultaneously. When two routes match the path and have the same {code1}, the older one (lowest {code2}) is used. Note that the priority for non-regex routes is different (longer non-regex routes are matched before shorter ones).

strip_path.label: Strip Path
strip_path.tooltip: When enabled, Kong removes the portion of the request path that matches the route's path before forwarding the request to the upstream. If the request exactly matches the route, the result is /. Disable if that's not desired.
strip_path.tooltipConfig: When matching a Route via one of the {code1}, strip the matching prefix from the upstream request URL.

preserve_host.label: Preserve Host
preserve_host.tooltip: Keeps the original Host header when proxying requests. Enable this if the upstream service requires the client's Host value. Disable if the service expects its own hostname.
preserve_host.tooltipConfig: When matching a Route via one of the {code1} domain names, use the request {code2} header in the upstream request headers. If set to {code3}, the upstream {code4} header will be that of the Service's {code5}.

paths.label: Paths
paths.tooltip: Match specific URL paths, such as /api/v1. Prefix with ~ to enable regex-based matching.

snis.label: SNIs
snis.tooltip: SNIs that match the route when using stream routing.

hosts.label: Hosts
hosts.tooltip: Match specific domain names (e.g., api.example.com). Prefix with ~ to enable regex-based matching.
hosts.tooltipConfig: A list of domain names that match this Route. Note that the hosts value is case sensitive.

methods.label: Methods
methods.search_placeholder: Search for a method or enter a custom method
methods.tooltip: Match certain HTTP methods, such as GET or POST. If no method is selected, all methods are included.

custom.label: Custom
custom.tooltip: Custom methods can be used with default selections. Uppercase characters are required.

headers.label: Headers
headers.tooltip: Match specific headers, such as x-api-version or x-region.
headers.tooltipConfig: One or more lists of values indexed by header name that will cause this Route to match if present in the request. The {code1} header cannot be used with this attribute: hosts should be specified using the {code2} attribute. When {code3} contains only one value and that value starts with the special prefix {code4}, the value is interpreted as a regular expression.

sources.label: Sources
sources.tooltip: A list of IP sources of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing.

destinations.label: Destinations
destinations.tooltip: A list of IP destinations of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing.

response_buffering.label: Response buffering
response_buffering.tooltip: Reads and buffers the full response from the upstream service before sending it to the client. Enable buffering if the client expects the complete response at once. Disable for faster streaming of large or chunked responses.

request_buffering.label: Request buffering
request_buffering.tooltip: Reads and buffers the full request body before proxying. Enable buffering if the upstream service requires the complete request before processing. Disable for faster streaming of large or chunked requests.

priority.label: Priority
priority.tooltip: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using expression simultaneously.

hint.advanced: To add more than one, use the Advanced options.

cannotChangeFlavor.create: The format of the route cannot be changed once created.
cannotChangeFlavor.edit: This route was configured in the {format} format, and cannot be changed after creation. You can switch to the {format} tab to edit, or create a new route in a different format instead.

expressions_editor.error: Error occurred while loading the Expressions editor. Please view the console for more details.

expression_playground.supported_protocols_hint: Currently only supports the following protocols: {protocols}
